definition: to endure (years of suffering)
bitter/hardship/pain/to suffer/to bring suffering to/painstakingly
to boil/to simmer
to cook on a slow fire/to extract by heating/to decoct/to endure

sentences.english: So are you planning to spend the summer sweating it out in Brooklyn?
sentences.chinese: 那你的暑假就準備在布魯克林苦熬嘍？

sentences.english: How many years can some people exist before they 're allowed to be free?
sentences.chinese: 一些人獲得自由前要苦熬過多少年？

sentences.english: Husband von from from that for purgatory released.
sentences.chinese: 丈夫馮矬子從那苦熬的煉獄中獲釋了。

sentences.english: They had a tough time during the war.
sentences.chinese: 戰爭期間她們苦熬度日。

definition: to break clear of all the troubles and hardships/to achieve success/to make it
variant of 挨[ai2]
to boil/to simmer
to cook on a slow fire/to extract by heating/to decoct/to endure
strenuously/persistently/hard/painful
one's utmost/(to fight or work) desperately hard/to put up a life or death struggle/at all costs
to have difficulty getting by/to struggle (financially etc)
to endure humiliation as part of an important mission (idiom); to suffer in silence
to go through challenging experiences/to become seasoned (in one's profession etc)
all black, no daylight (idiom); a world without justice
suffering/torture
to work hard
hard times
to bear humiliation to save one's skin (idiom)
to pass one's days/to scratch out a difficult, meager existence
to suffer enough from/to suffer all kinds of/to have one's fill of
to tire oneself out through overwork/to work oneself to death
